text: Tomasz Frankowski (born 16 August 1974) is a retired Polish football player. He retired in 2013. ==Club career statistics== |- |1991–92||rowspan="2"|Jagiellonia Białystok||Second League||3||0 |- |1992–93||Ekstraklasa||9||1 |- |1993–94||rowspan="3"|Strasbourg||rowspan="3"|Division 1||0||0 |- |1994–95||10||2 |- |1995–96||11||0 |- |1996||Nagoya Grampus Eight||J. League 1||0||0 |- |1996–97||Poitiers||Championnat National||32||22 |- |1997–98||Martigues||Division 2||19||5 |- |1998–99||rowspan="8"|Wisła Kraków||rowspan="8"|Ekstraklasa||29||21 |- |1999–00||26||17 |- |2000/01||28||18 |- |2001/02||26||9 |- |2002/03||12||6 |- |2003/04||22||15 |- |2004/05||26||25 |- |2005/06||4||4 |- |2005/06||Elche||Segunda División||14||8 |- |2005/06||Wolverhampton Wanderers||League Championship||16||0 |- |2006/07||Tenerife||Segunda División||19||3 |- |2007/08||Wolverhampton Wanderers||League Championship||0||0 |- |2008||Chicago Fire||Major League Soccer||17||2 |- |2008/09||rowspan="5"|Jagiellonia Białystok||rowspan="5"|Ekstraklasa||13||6 |- |2009/10||30||11 |- |2010/11||29||14 |- |2011/12||25||15 |- |2012/13||23||6 302||168 72||29 0||0 33||11 16||0 17||2 336||164 |} ==Honours== Strasbourg * UEFA Intertoto Cup: 1995 Wisła Kraków * Ekstraklasa: 1998–99, 2000–01, 2002–03, 2003–04, 2004–05 * Polish Cup: 2001–02, 2002–03 * Polish League Cup: 2000–01 * Polish Super Cup: 2001 Jagiellonia Białystok * Polish Cup: 2009–10 * Polish Super Cup: 2010 Individual * Ekstraklasa top scorer: 1998–99, 2000–01, 2004–05, 2010–11 * Polish Cup top scorer: 2001–02, 2009–10 ==Political activity== Frankowski is a member of Civic Platform led by Donald Tusk. In European Parliament election in 2019 he was elected from the first place in Podlaskie and Warmian-Masurian constituency.
